resources.string: Could the other team guess the word?

Catch Phrase is a party game for the whole family.
	An even number of players sit in a circle, and every other person is on a team. The player holding the phone tries to get anyone on his team to guess the phrase in the middle of the screen, without saying any part of the word, or version of it. For example, if the phrase is "baseball bat," he may not say any of the following words: "baseball," "bat," "base," "ball," "bats," etc.
	If he can't get his team to guess the word, he may pass, but he can only pass so many times before he's stuck with the word he has. Once his team has guessed the phrase, he passes the device to the person to his left. She should tap %s and try to get her team to guess her word.
	When the buzzer runs out, the team that is not holding the phone gets a point. If that team can also guess the word their opponents were supposed to guess, they score an additional point.
	Once one team has reached a certain number of points (configurable), they win!
Actual value will be random, but about as long as specified
The other team correctly guessed the word after the buzzer rang
The other team incorrectly guessed the word after the buzzer rang
The buzzer rang before I could press Got it
Who was holding the device when time ran out?
How many passes should be allowed?

This version of the game is for small groups of people. The goal is to get everyone else to guess as many words as possible before time runs out. At that time, you simply pass the device to the person to your left and let them take a turn giving clues.
